translated: Jātaka🔽The Group of Three Collections🔽The Pot-born One
and the nigrodha and kapittha trees;
why should you die of hunger?”
Just as I am happy today,
having eaten the fruits of the trees.”
“What the forest-dweller would deceive the forest-dweller,
the monkey would deceive the monkey;
The young monkey should be trusted,
not the old monkey, who is just old.”
The Udumbara Jātaka is the eighth.
